Reviews.Title: “Really good place”
Reviews.Author: carlotortora
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value for money. Centrally located next to Reforma, great for its proximity to business locations. Spacious, nice rooms, impeccably clean, and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “orale!!”
Reviews.Author: papinico
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were recently renovated I had no problems with the room, but as a frequent guess at this hotel i did notice some things have changed such a the management.There are no more tv or phone in the bathroom , phone system did not work very well anyway, and the internet service is limited to some sites and others are blocked with a pop up asking for money to view sites. other then that i would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, friendly and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Patricia297452
Reviews.Content: This relatively small hotel has bigger than expected rooms. I stayed in a double room and it had a lounge, kitchenette, a spacious bathroom and big closets. The staff is friendly and helpful. Well maintained all over. Reasonable price. I feel pleased with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: AyeEat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location. Not too far from Chapultepec Park, the Anthropology Museum, a huge number of restaurants, cantinas, and (of course) street food. Right around the corner from a bank. The rooms were clean, and big, I loved the balcony. The jacuzzi-tub made for a relaxing bath at night. The staff were very helpful with booking expeditions to nearby Teotihuacan, Xochimilco, etc.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't have been more pleased”
Reviews.Author: aloshek
Reviews.Content: We didn't even get out of the cab and the bell boy was there for our bags and to escort us to our room. He took the time to go through each room and explain how everything worked. The hotel room looked EXACTLY like the pictures online right down to the bedspread. I was impressed with their responsible use of motion sensor lights in the hallways and the use of the keycard to engage the room lights in an effort to conserve energy. Housekeeping was very accommodating to the unusual hours that we kept and politely called to see if we wanted our suite cleaned or if we were in need of anything each day. As it was my intent to improve my Spanish-speaking skills, I was thrilled with the staff's patience and encouragement when attempting to engage in conversation. Room Service was timely, the food was fantastic and at a very reasonable price. Aside from that, the location was fabulous and very quiet and within walking distance of the Zona Rosa, shopping, the Paseo de la Reforma, and just a moment's ride on the subway from the Centro HistÃ³rico.

Reviews.Title: “The best in its category in this area”
Reviews.Author: Proffess
Reviews.Content: Most suites in this hotel have a street facing balcony, a kitchenette, a king size and very comfortable bed, a full bathroom, and a small lounge area - not to mention copious storage space. Prices range from 67US - 98US per night, depending on the season or what convention is in town. The decor is peach and mid 90's, but the rooms are plush and clean and well maintained. The bed really is very comfortable, as are the cushions. Once these rooms would have been quite upmarket, and they still kind of are now. They have a certain charm and comfort. The kitchenette has a sink, cupboards, hot plate and microwave oven - which is more than adequate to cook meals with. The service is good. The street is probably the best and safest place to stay in this area,and there is undercover parking. i like these suites and would definately choose them, for the price range, on my next visit to the city,

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel centrally located for our stay in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: MEMZIllinois
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at Suites del Angel. Would certainly stay there again. The rooms were spacious and clean. The staff was pleasant and helpful and most spoke good English. We used the microwave and refrigerator and had several meals in our room. We had our breakfast in the hotel and it was very reasonable. The living room had a sleeper which could be used if one person was disturbed by the others sleeping. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to the Insurgentes Metro Station and from there can navigate to any part of Mexico City. One of the red double decker tourist bus stops is near the tourist information booth on Paseo de la Reforma near the Monumento a la Independencia. Using this tourist bus you get an overview of some of the highlights of Mexico City and you can get on and off as you please. We used it to go to the Museo Nacional de Antropologia, one of the best for pre-Hispanic art.

Reviews.Title: “in a nutshell: I'll never go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: gandalfy2k
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one thing and one thing only: Location, location, location. At the heart of the financial service, they would be an excellent option if onlyâ€¦ â€¦if only they didnâ€™t had such a terrible service!. At my arrival, they had me waiting more than half an hour for the check in; there were some other guests before me, so they lady at the front desk was giving them the customary explanation about Mexico City. No problem there, except there were two other employees doing literally nothing and no one had the initiative to check me in or even propose it. BE CARFUL! the hotel didnâ€™t honored my online price and they charged me the breakfasts that were supposed to be included! if they are dishonest about that, they can be it about any other stuff. Also, they did not give me an invoice (factura) arguing that because I booked online, I could not get one. THAT IS CALLED TAX EVASION!

Reviews.Title: “My New Second Home”
Reviews.Author: pxcaballero
Reviews.Content: I started to plan my vacation almost six months in advance, taking a very long time to pick which place to stay. My husband and I ended up flying for 24 hours, due to the "arctic blast of 2008". We were welcomed by Bernardo and Mari who were very welcoming, while we were checking in Bernardo took our bags to our room so we could have a smoother check-in. We were given a tour of our room and discovered that we had a t.v. in the living room, bedroom, and bathroom. Every day my husband and I were welcomed to the sounds of birds chirping there was a nest near our room; and the staff willing to help you with anything. There were a couple of loud moments when our surrounding guests were not being aware that there is a quite time after ten. But the staff took care of every problem. We spent a two week stay that included Christmas and New Years. We were welcomed one night to a small gift from the hotel to show thanks for choosing Suites del Angel for our Holiday stay. We were even welcomed by Mari to join her and friend to go to the New Years Eve celebration that was happening right in front of the Angel. Which was a free concert of Los Tigers del Norte. I can't write enough about how great the room and the staff was. The ladies that were in charge of our floor were always happy and excited to hear about or adventure from the day before and willing to give us tips on the were the best food was or best buys could be located. I can't wait to back to say hi to my second home and new friends.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: LVBCapeTown
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Suites Del Angel whilst attending the World AIDS conference in August. The city was busy and I had stayed in another hotel for one night which just didn't compare. Although the hotel is old and a bit dated I found it clean, certainly the rooms were a lot larger than expected and the staff exceptionally friendly and helpful. The breakfast was fair. I loved the area, it was convenient for most things and if you got lost you just asked for directions to "the angel" and everyone knew where to send you. I would definitely stay here if I ever had the good fortune to visit Mexico again. There are some really good restaurants across the road from the hotel, give them a try you'll be pleasantly surprised. All in all a great experience, I felt very much at home at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “highly overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: mariatraveler
Reviews.Content: This old and run-down hotel is totally overpriced. The suites are nice and roomy, but again, old and run-down. We paid $215/night. We had stayed just a few days earlier at Eurostar, also in the "zona rosa" and their suites were the same, only newer, and we paid only $67/night! Del Angel is on a nicer street, but much farther from the metro too. We were SO disappointed when we got there. Don't let the nice pictures of the lobby fool you. It doesn't look that nice. The staff was nice and helpful, but the hotel is just not worth the price. I would not stay there again, unless I was getting a room for under $80.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay and friendly”
Reviews.Author: RoseCityTexas
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I stayed here from July 24th through July 28th. The suite was very nice -- not brand new - but clean and very nice. My son slept in the entry room to the suite on a pull out couch, and watched the TV in that room. Another TV in the bathroom. The bathroom was modern and nice. I slept in the king size bed in the separate bedroom, with yet another TV. The connecting kitchen area had burners, plates, etc., including a water filter tap for drinking water. The cable TV had at least two, maybe three, english language stations with spanish sub-titles. Watched a little bit of "Friends" on the Warner channel. There is a really busy restaurant right around the corner, which fronted on Tiber street, which looked nice and was really crowded with locals for lunch and supper, but unfortunately we did not get the chance to eat there (go out the front entrance of Suites del Angel and turn right, and then right again on Rio Tiber, and it is there at Rio Lerma at Rio Tiber). The staff at Suites del Angel was really friendly and helpful, especially Gustavo. The maintenance man even fixed my eye glasses with a precision screwdriver when the lens popped out. There was an interesting mix of people staying at Suites del Angel - quite a few Mexican nationals I believe, as well as those from other countries. It seemed to be a good central location in Mexico City. I believe we paid around $69 a night, with booking through the AARP travel website. The Sanborns around the corner at the Monument to Independence, at Rio Tiber and La Reforma, is good for a late night desert and coffee. There was also a really popular (with locals) and interesting looking Catina if you turn left out of the hotel entrance on Rio Lerma , and go about 50 yards, on your left. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Suites del Angel”
Reviews.Author: TampaCubana
Reviews.Content: Suites del Angel was a pleasant surprise in every way. Given the reasonable rates, we weren't sure what to expect, but we had an excellent stay. The rooms were clean and well-tended, the front desk staff (especially Maria and Gabriel) were incredibly helpful and friendly, and the hotel itself is located in a nice neighborhood close to several nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to returning to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: awaters80
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for a week last month and had a really good time. I chose this hotel because it had good reviews, and lo, I made a very good decision. The room was clean, small for a suite, but having two separate rooms was great- we had a few people come over for drinks one night and not haing to subject them to our bedroom was great! The shower/bathrtub/jet tub was great, tons of hot water and clean towles. Balcony was cute, we had it open the entire time we were there! The restaurant downstairs was affordable, we typically had our breakfast there. Id love to go back to this hotel soon! Concierge was helpful, though they didnt have as much to offer in terms of information as say, a more expensive hotel. They did however, get us tickets to two separate tours, which were great and well worth the $30 USD they cost. Great experience for the cost, Id give this place two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kgtBoston
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5 night stay. Overall, we were very satsified with our experience. The hotel staff were friendly and responded to requests promptly. The housekeeping staff kept the runs nice and clean. This is a very nice hotel for the value, nothing fancy, but a good experience. The in hotel restaurant was decent, and there are plenty of very good restaurants near by. We were very impressed with the museums and art in Mexico city. We will definitely return and would be happy to stay at the Suites Del Angel again.

HotelInfo.Name: Suites Del Angel
HotelInfo.Address: Rio Lerma 162 | Col. Cuauhtemoc, Mexico City 06500, Mexico
